DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The anchor point defines/is the tip of the inverted cone.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol will typically be oriented upright.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires one anchor point. The center point defines/is the center of the symbol.
DrawRule.Orientation: The symbol is typically centered over the desired location.

DrawRule.AnchorPoints: This symbol requires three anchor points. Point 1 is the tip of the arrowhead. Points 2 and 3 define the endpoints of the curved line on the back side of the symbol.
DrawRule.Orientation: Orientation is determined by the anchor points. The back side of the symbol encompasses the ambush position with the airhead shaft positioned at the center of mass, while the arrowhead points in the direction of fire.
DrawRule.SizeShape: Points 2 and 3 determine the length of the curved line on the back side of the symbol. The rear of the arrow should connect to the midpoint of the line between points 2 and 3.

Amplifier.Label: Special C2 Headquarters
Amplifier.Description: A text modifier for units; indicator is contained inside the frame; contains the name of the special C2 Headquarters.

Amplifier.Label: Feint/Dummy Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies an offensive or defensive unit intended to draw the enemy's attention away from the area of the main attack.

Amplifier.Label: Installation
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used to show a particular symbol denotes an installation.

Amplifier.Label: Platform Type
Amplifier.Description: Electronic Intelligence Notation (ELNOT) or Communications Intelligence Notation (CENOT)

Amplifier.Label: Equipment Teardown Time
Amplifier.Description: Equipment teardown time in minutes

Amplifier.Label: Common Identifier
Amplifier.Description: Example: 'Hawk' for Hawk SAM system

Amplifier.Label: Auxiliary Equipment Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier for equipment that indicates the presence of a towed sonar array.

Amplifier.Label: Area of Uncertainty
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier for units, equipment and installations that indicates the area where an object is most likely to be, based on the object's last report and the reporting accuracty of the sensor that detected the object.

Amplifier.Label: Dead Reckoning Trailer
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies where an object should be located at present, given its last reported course and speed.

Amplifier.Label: Speed Leader
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that depicts the speed and direction of movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Pairing Line
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that connects two objects and is updated dynamically as the positions of the objects change.

Amplifier.Label: Operational Condition
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for equipment or installations that indicates operational condition or capacity.

Amplifier.Label: Engagement Bar
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for equipment or installations that indicates operational condition or capacity.

Amplifier.Label: Target Designator
Amplifier.Description: A six character text modifier used in Fire Support operations to uniquely designate targets in accordance with STANAG 2147, where characters 1 and 2 are alphabetic, and characters 3-6 are numeric: AANNNN

Amplifier.Label: Guarded Unit
Amplifier.Description: During ballistic missile defense, some tracks are designated as guarded by a particular unit.

Amplifier.Label: Special Designator
Amplifier.Description: Special track designators such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks are denoted here.

Amplifier.Label: Country
Amplifier.Description: Identifies the country of the organization being shown.

Amplifier.Label: Symbol Icon
Amplifier.Description: The innermost part of a symbol that represents a joint military object.

Amplifier.Label: Echelon
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier in a unit symbol that identifies command level.

Amplifier.Label: Quantity
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier in an equipment symbol that identifies the number of items present.

Amplifier.Label: Task Force Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier that identifies a unit or stability operations symbol as a task force.

Amplifier.Label: Frame Shape Modifier
Amplifier.Description: A graphic modifier that displays affiliation, battle dimension, or exercise amplifying descriptors of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Reinforced or Reduced
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier in a unit symbol that dispays (+) for reinforced, (-) for reduced, (±) for reinforced and reduced.

Amplifier.Label: Staff Comments
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Amplifier.Label: Additional Information
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Amplifier.Label: Evaluation Rating
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.

Amplifier.Label: Combat Effectiveness
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.

Amplifier.Label: Signature Equipment
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for hostile equipment, '!' indicates detectable electronic signatures.

Amplifier.Label: Higher Formation
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units that indicates number or title of higher echelon command (corps are designated by Roman numerals).

Amplifier.Label: Hostile (Enemy)
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for equipment, letters 'ENY' denote hostile symbols.

Amplifier.Label: IFF/SIF/AIS
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF/AIS identification modes and codes.

Amplifier.Label: Direction of Movement Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: Mobility Indicator
Amplifier.Description: A graphic amplifier for units and equipment that identifies the direction of movement or intended movement of an object.

Amplifier.Label: SIGINT Mobility Indicator
Amplifier.Description: M=Mobile, S=Static, or U=Uncertain

Amplifier.Label: Headquarters Staff Indicator/Offset Location Indicator
Amplifier.Description: Headquarters staff indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations that identifies a unit as a headquarters.
Amplifier.Remarks: Offset location indicator: A graphic amplifier for units, equipment and installations used when placing an object away from its actual location.

Amplifier.Label: Unique Designation
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Amplifier.Remarks: Identifies acquisition number when used with SIGINT symbology.

Amplifier.Label: Type
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Amplifier.Label: Date/Time Group (DTG)
Amplifier.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a date-time group (DDHHMMSSZMONYYYY) or O/O for on order.
Amplifier.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by four digits representing the year.

Amplifier.Label: Altitude/Depth
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that displays either altitude, flight level, depth for submerged objects.
Amplifier.Remarks: Alternatively, used to indicate the height of equipment or structures on the ground.

Amplifier.Label: Location
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that displays a symbol's location in degrees, minutes, and decimal minutes.
Amplifier.Remarks: Alternatively, in MGRS or other applicable display format.
Amplifier.Note: To support homeland security and homeland defense, the federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) US National Grid (USNG) standard when referenced to North American Datum 1983 (NAD83) is operationally equivalent to and is an accepted substitute for MGRS coordinates referenced to WGS 84. Note that at mapping scales of 1:5000 and smaller, NAD83 and WGS 84 are considered equivalent.

Amplifier.Label: Speed
Amplifier.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD 6040.

ContextAmplifier.Description: Graphic Amplifier may be specified by extension

Field.Name: AL
Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Aircraft: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Air Vehicle Icon
Field.Description: Uses icon and sector modifiers

Field.Name: P
Field.Label: IFF/SIF
Field.Description: A text amplifier displaying IFF/SIF Identification modes and codes. Display priority: Mode 5, Mode S, Mode 4, Mode 2, Mode 3
Field.Remarks: Mode 2 Prefix: 2:#### Example: 2:1234

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: X
Field.Label: Altitude
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units that displays altitude flight level.
Field.Remarks: Measurement units shall be displayed within the string. Examples: 1500MSL FL150

Field.Name: Z
Field.Label: Speed
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and equipment that displays velocity as set forth in MIL-STD-6040.

Field.Description: Example: 'Hawk' for Hawk SAM system

Field.Description: The innermost part of a symbol that represents a joint military object.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Information
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations.

Field.Name: J
Field.Label: Evaluation Rating
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that consists of a one-letter reliability rating and a one-number credibility rating.
Field.Remarks: Reliability: A-F and Credibility: 1-6

Field.Name: K
Field.Label: Combat Effectiveness
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units and installations that indicates unit effectiveness or installation capability.
Field.Remarks: Fully Operational = FO, Substantially Operational = SO, Marginally Operational = MO, Not Operational = NO, Unknown = UNK

Field.Name: L
Field.Label: Signature Equipment
Field.Description: A text amplifier for hostile equipment, '!' indicates detectable electronic signatures.

Field.Name: R

Field.Name: A
Field.Label: Ship Icon
Field.Description: Uses icon and sector modifiers

Field.Name: P
Field.Label: Automatic Identification System (AIS)
Field.Description: A text amplifier displaying the maritime Automatic Identification System.

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Field.Name: Z

Field.Label: Operational Condition
Field.Description: Indicates operational condition.
Field.Remarks: Comprised of only one color. Ex. Satellite: Red - damaged, Green – fully capable. Ex: Missile: Red – imminent threat, Green – no threat.

Field.Name: AO
Field.Label: Engagement Bar
Field.Description: May denote 1ocal/remote status, engagement status, and weapon type.
Field.Remarks: A:BBB-CC, where A = remote/local, BBB = engagement status, CC = weapon asset.

Field.Name: AQ
Field.Label: Guarded Unit
Field.Description: During ballistic missile defense, some tracks are designated as guarded by a particular unit.
Field.Remarks: The 2-character string, BG

Field.Name: AR
Field.Label: Special Designator
Field.Description: Special track designators, such as Non-Real Time (NRT) and Tactically Significant (SIG) tracks, are denoted here.
Field.Remarks: The 3-character strings, NRT or SIG

Field.Name: T
Field.Label: Unique Designation (Track Number)
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment, and installations that uniquely identifies a particular symbol or track number.
Field.Remarks: Prefix = TN:##### Example: TN:13579

Field.Name: V
Field.Label: Type
Field.Description: A text amplifier for equipment that indicates types of equipment.

Field.Name: AS
Field.Label: Country Indicator
Field.Description: A three-letter code that indicates the country of origin of the organization (STANAG 1059).
Field.Remarks: In stability activities, this field can be used for factions or groups.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: Free text.
Field.Remarks: Can be used by staff for information required by commander.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Informartion
Field.Description: Free text.

Field.Name: J
Field.Label: Evaluation Rating
Field.Description: Degree of confidence that may be placed on the information represented by the symbol.
Field.Remarks: It is shown as one letter and one number made up of Reliability of Source and Credibility of Information.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: It is used to denote precise location.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a datetime group (DDHHMMSSZMONYY) or O/O for on order.
Field.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by two digits.

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Field.Name: AS
Field.Label: Country Indicator
Field.Description: A three-letter code that indicates the country of origin of the organization (STANAG 1059).
Field.Remarks: In stability activities, this field can be used for factions or groups.

Field.Name: G
Field.Label: Staff Comments
Field.Description: Free text.
Field.Remarks: Can be used by staff for information required by commander.

Field.Name: H
Field.Label: Additional Informartion
Field.Description: Free text.

Field.Name: J
Field.Label: Evaluation Rating
Field.Description: Degree of confidence that may be placed on the information represented by the symbol.
Field.Remarks: It is shown as one letter and one number made up of Reliability of Source and Credibility of Information.

Field.Name: S
Field.Label: Offset Location Indicator
Field.Description: It is used to denote precise location.

Field.Name: W
Field.Label: Date-Time Group
Field.Description: An alphanumeric designator for displaying a datetime group (DDHHMMSSZMONYY) or O/O for on order.
Field.Remarks: The date-time group is composed of a group of six numeric digits with a time zone suffix and the standardized three-letter abbreviation for the month followed by two digits.

Field.Name: Y
Field.Label: Location
Field.Description: A text amplifier for units, equipment and installations that displays a symbol’s location in degrees, minutes and seconds (or in UTM or other applicable display format).

Amplifier.Label: Extension
Amplifier.Description: Details specified by extension
